page.title: 09PENNYVENIE FARM-2
page.content:
Except for the ploughing of the infield there is no cultivation of the land. These fields are used to hold surplus stock before it is taken to market at Ayr. The soil of the valley is poor. Most years the area has a lot of rain and the growing season is short. The farm lies more than 200 metres above sea level except for the former policies of Camlarg bordering the Cummock Water which Mr Ireland uses for grazing new lambs.
Our group paid two visits to Pennyvenie Farm to talk to Mr and Mrs Ireland. During the second of these we walked over part of his lands to see places and things he had told us about. This included part of the former village of Pennyvenie and the disused railway that served the old mines.
